strings.drefFormPeopleInNeedDescriptionSlowSudde: People in Need (PIN) are those members whose physical security, basic rights, dignity, living conditions or livelihoods are threatened or have been disrupted, and whose current level of access to basic services, goods and social protection is inadequate to re-establish normal living conditions without additional assistance.
strings.drefFormPeopleAffectedDescriptionImminen: Includes all those whose lives and livelihoods are at risk as a direct result of the shock or stress.
strings.drefFormLessonsLearnedDescription: Specify how the lessons learnt from these previous operations are being used to mitigate similar challenges in the current operation
strings.drefFormNsFundingDetail: If yes, please specify which operations
strings.drefFormNsFundingDetailDescription: Enter MDR code and year. Example: MDRXXX YEAR, MDRXXX YEAR
strings.drefFormNsRequestFund: Did the National Society request funding from DREF for that event(s)?
strings.drefFormRecurrentText: If you have answered yes to all questions above, justify why the use of DREF for a recurrent event, or how this event should not be considered recurrent
strings.drefFormScopeAndScaleDescription: Describe the extent this hazard will produce negative impacts on lives, livelihoods, well-being and infrastructure. Explain which people are most likely to experience the impacts of this hazard? Where do they live, and why are they vulnerable? Please explain which groups (e.g elderly, children, people with disabilities, IDPs, Refugees, etc.) are most likely to be affected? Provide historic information on how communities have been affected by the magnitude of this hazard in the past?
strings.drefFormScopeAndScaleEvent: Scope and scale of the event
strings.drefFormSlowEventDate: Date when the trigger was met
strings.drefFormUploadPhotos: Upload photos (e.g. impact of the events, NS in the field, assessments)
strings.drefFormWhatWhereWhenDescriptionPoint1: What happened: Briefly explain the nature of the emergency (e.g., flood, earthquake, epidemic). Include key details such as the intensity, and any unique aspects of the event.
strings.drefFormWhatWhereWhenDescriptionPoint2: Where: Specify the geographic location(s) affected. Be as precise as possible, including names of countries, regions, cities, or specific areas impacted by the event.
strings.drefFormWhatWhereWhenDescriptionPoint3: When: Indicate the date and time when the event occurred or began. If the situation is ongoing, mention that and provide relevant updates on the timeframe.
strings.drefOperationalLearningPlatformLabel: To access the Operational Learning Dashboard and check learnings for the country, {clickHereLink}
strings.drefFormSourceInformationDescription: Add the links and the name of the sources, the name will be shown in the export, as an hyperlink.
strings.drefHazardExpectedTitle: When and where is the hazard expected to happen?
strings.drefHazardExpectedDescription: Include here the forecasted date of impact as well as the geographical areas at risk.
strings.drefHazardTitle: Explain the underlying vulnerabilities and risks the hazard poses for at-risk communities?
strings.drefHazardDescription: Based on comparison of past events, what humanitarian impacts do you expect? Of what magnitude? (e.g. last time there was a cyclone making landfall with this windspeed, XX houses were destroyed, and we had to launch a DREF/emergency appeal for CHF xxx).
